name: Tyrion Lannister
description: Tyrion Lannister is the youngest child of Lord Tywin Lannister and Lady Joanna Lannister, who died giving birth to him. Born with dwarfism, Tyrion has faced scorn and mockery throughout his life, often using his sharp wit and intellect as both defense and weapon. Despite his family's disdain, he possesses a keen political mind and a surprisingly strong moral compass. Unlike many in Westeros, Tyrion strives to protect the realm and those who cannot defend themselves, even when it means opposing his own family's interests. His journey is marked by his resilience in the face of prejudice and his unwavering commitment to justice and knowledge.
memorableMoments: Slapping Prince Joffrey across the face for his disrespectful behavior.
Leading the defense of King's Landing during the Battle of Blackwater.
His trial speech where he declares, 'I wish I was the monster you think I am.'

name: Daenerys Targaryen
description:
Whether Daenerys will be remembered as a legendary savior or a formidable conqueror, her impact on Westeros is undeniable. From the start, she has been portrayed as the destined ruler of the Iron Throne, with a narrative that runs parallel to events in King's Landing. Her journey includes pivotal moments like reviving dragons, which reintroduced magic into the world.

Her ultimate role in this saga remains uncertain, but her influence on the unfolding story is undeniable. Daenerys Targaryen stands as one of the key figures shaping the series' outcome.
memorableMoments: When she emerged from Khal Drogo's funeral pyre, standing bare and accompanied by three newborn dragons.
Her commanding presence that led to victory over the Unsullied with just a single command: "Dracarys."
The first time she soared on Drogon, escaping an attack in Meereen.

name: Jon Snow
description:
Jon Snow stands out as one of Game of Thrones' most compelling characters, embodying classic heroism with his unwavering honor, kindness, intelligence, persistence, and selflessness. Time and again, he prioritizes duty over personal desires, demonstrating true leadership.

In a tragic twist, Jon is killed in a mutiny by men he once commanded. His allies resort to magic in desperation to bring him back, underscoring his importance as both a good man and their leader.

Beyond his role in the Night’s Watch, Jon's mysterious parentage adds depth to his character. Known initially as Ned Stark's illegitimate son, Jon has shown little interest in claiming the Iron Throne. However, should he discover a legitimate claim to it, along with the support of the North as "King in the North," it could lead to fascinating developments, especially when encountering Daenerys and her dragons.
memorableMoments: Discovering his white direwolf pup, Ghost, and feeling an instant connection.
Choosing to remain Lord Commander of the Night’s Watch over being legitimized as a Stark.
Being resurrected by Melisandre in Season 6, surprising everyone who believed him dead.

name: Cersei Lannister
description:
Cersei Lannister is one of Game of Thrones' most compelling and enigmatic figures. Her character blends a ruthless ambition with deep flaws and cunning intelligence. As a woman navigating the treacherous political landscape, she strives for equality in a male-dominated world. Her mantra, "when you play the game of thrones, you win or you die," has guided her actions, earning both fear and respect as she endures when more honorable figures fall.

Despite committing terrible acts and spiraling into madness, Cersei's determination to ascend the political ladder is undeniable. Her resilience in a hostile world makes her an unforgettable character in Westeros.
memorableMoments: The shocking moment Bran witnesses Cersei engaging in incest with her brother.
The infamous Walk of Shame that remains etched in memory for both fans and Cersei herself.
Despite losing much, Cersei achieves a bittersweet triumph when she finally claims the Iron Throne as queen.

name: Arya Stark
description:
Arya Stark’s journey through Game of Thrones is marked by resilience and adaptability. Despite being one of the series' least powerful principal characters, she demonstrates remarkable strength and resourcefulness. Arya has faced numerous challenges, from periods where her character development seemed to stall, to becoming a formidable survivor in Westeros.

Her ability to reinvent herself — as a water dancer, under her nickname Arry, or as a blind assassin named "No One" — highlights her versatility. Among her most compelling story arcs is her travels with the Hound, which stands out as one of the series' finest moments.
memorableMoments: Arya's initiation into killing is a pivotal moment for her character, famously instructing to 'stick him with the pointy end.'
Her rare laughter at Sansa’s departure from the Eyrie before Arya’s arrival underscores her unique perspective.
Each name crossed off her list of targets signifies her quest for vengeance, culminating in the unforgettable and satisfying death of Walder Frey.

name: Jaime Lannister
description:
Infamously known as the Kingslayer, Jaime Lannister's early actions included betraying his oath by assassinating King Aerys II. Once considered one of Westeros' greatest swordsmen, Jaime’s complex journey reveals layers beyond his initial villainous persona.

His deep, albeit controversial, love for his twin sister Cersei and a unique bond with his brother Tyrion add depth to his character. Key events — the loss of his right hand, which humbles him; the death of his father Tywin Lannister; and the tragic losses of his children — all contribute to Jaime's evolution.

His relationships with Brienne of Tarth and Bronn further illustrate his multifaceted nature, moving beyond his 'Prince Charming from Shrek' nickname. Though not completely redeemed, he is no longer the irredeemable figure he once appeared to be.
memorableMoments: His decision to push Bran Stark out a window to protect Cersei marks a turning point: 'The things we do for love.'
The loss of his sword hand in Season 3 after being captured by Locke.
Choosing loyalty over personal safety, Jaime's strategic takeover of Riverrun during its siege is pivotal.

name: Eddard Stark
description:
Eddard Stark's role in Game of Thrones is foundational, setting the tone with his unwavering commitment to honor, loyalty, and justice. His principles profoundly influence his children, many of whom become pivotal figures in Westeros' political landscape.

Ned’s tragic execution early in the series underscores a critical theme: sometimes, honor can be perilous. His legacy continues to echo throughout the story, shaping characters’ actions long after his death and serving as both a heroic archetype and a cautionary tale about the complexities of power and morality.
memorableMoments: Ned imparts a crucial lesson on honor at the series' start: 'The man who carries the sentence swings the sword.'
Ignoring advice to navigate court politics carefully, he confronts Cersei Lannister about her children's legitimacy.
His shocking execution in Season 1’s penultimate episode marks one of television's most unexpected twists.

name: Tywin Lannister
description:
As one of Game of Thrones' most formidable figures, Tywin Lannister plays a pivotal role in shaping Westeros' political landscape. His influence is evident from the sacking of King's Landing during Robert's Rebellion to his strategic union with the crown, laying the groundwork for major plot developments throughout the series.

Charles Dance’s portrayal captures Tywin's commanding presence and unnerving authority, leaving an indelible impression on both characters and audience alike. He drives significant character development among those around him — challenging Jaime Lannister to prove himself as his true heir, compelling Cersei Lannister to prioritize her family above all else, and constantly reminding Tyrion of his perceived inadequacies.
memorableMoments: At Harrenhal, Tywin appoints a girl disguised as a boy as his cupbearer, unknowingly choosing Arya Stark.
In an act that irreparably damages their relationship, he arranges for Tyrion to stand trial for Joffrey's murder.
Despite his stature and power, Tywin meets an ironic end when he is murdered by his son Jaime while in the privy.

name: Varys "The Spider"
description:
Known as the Master of Whisperers, Varys plays a crucial role in Game of Thrones' intricate web of politics and intrigue. His network of informants, affectionately termed his 'little birds,' provides him with vital secrets that make him one of Westeros' most influential power players.

Varys often finds himself competing with Littlefinger as the primary architect behind many secretive manipulations aimed at achieving larger goals. He is instrumental in guiding Daenerys Targaryen on her path to power and orchestrating Tyrion Lannister’s escape from execution to align with her mission of restoring the Targaryens, all under the guise of serving 'the good of the realm.' Despite his calm demeanor, Varys remains an enigmatic figure whose true motives are perpetually shrouded in mystery.
memorableMoments: Arya Stark eavesdrops on a conversation between Varys and Illyrio Mopatis in Season 1, revealing their plans to resurrect the Targaryen dynasty.
Varys's decision to become a eunuch, following an encounter with a sorcerer who castrated him as part of a spell, marks a defining moment in his life.
In alignment with his longstanding strategy, Varys allies himself with Daenerys Targaryen and sails with her to reclaim Westeros.

name: Catelyn Stark
description:
Catelyn Stark embodies much more than simply being the matriarch of House Stark. As the Lady of Winterfell, her influence extends deeply over her husband and children, playing a pivotal role in the unfolding saga of Game of Thrones.

Her resilience is profoundly tested as she witnesses her family torn apart by tragic events, making her one of Westeros' most formidable and steadfast figures. Her descent into despair culminates tragically at The Red Wedding, marking it as one of the series' most heart-wrenching moments.
memorableMoments: Defying orders, Catelyn captures Tyrion Lannister and takes him to the Vale for trial, accusing him of Jon Arryn's murder.
In a desperate bid to ensure her daughters' safety, she decides to release Jaime Lannister, Robb Stark’s prisoner.
It is through Catelyn that we experience the harrowing realization and subsequent horror of the Red Wedding's betrayal.

name: Sansa Stark
description:
Initially perceived as the least likable member of the Stark family, Sansa's journey in Game of Thrones is transformative. Unlike her sister Arya, she yearned for a life filled with luxury and power, aspiring to be Queen. However, reality in Westeros taught her harsh lessons, through immense loss and suffering.

Sansa’s resilience becomes evident as she adapts and endures, learning to navigate the brutal world around her. She begins to master 'The Game' by leveraging Littlefinger's interest in her and ultimately orchestrates a well-deserved revenge on Ramsay Bolton, showcasing her growth from naivety to strategic acumen.
memorableMoments: Unaware of the dangers surrounding her, Sansa inadvertently betrays her father Ned Stark to Cersei Lannister in Season 1, leading to his capture and execution.
Disguised as 'Alayne,' she boldly reveals her true identity to the lords of the Vale, reclaiming her power.
After enduring Ramsay Bolton's horrific abuses, Sansa exacts revenge by having him fed to his own dogs.

name: Davos Seaworth
description:
In the ruthless world of Game of Thrones, few characters remain consistently likable and genuine without facing dire consequences. Davos Seaworth is a notable exception, though he has not been spared from sorrow and loss. Liam Cunningham's portrayal imbues Davos with a warmth and authenticity that adds humanity to the series' complex web of political intrigue and supernatural threats.

Davos, originally a smuggler who becomes an advisor to kings, serves as the moral compass for the show. This humble man is guided by a strong personal code, recognizing that what might be prudent isn’t always morally correct. He tirelessly advocates for justice and self-belief among characters often consumed by ambition.

Whether encouraging those around him or making heartfelt pleas when all else fails, Davos continually demonstrates his commitment to sacrificing for the greater good—a truly regal pursuit beyond any throne claim.
memorableMoments: As Stannis Baratheon's Hand of the King, Davos leads the Baratheon fleet into the pivotal Battle of Blackwater.
Because of Shireen’s influence on him, he becomes the one to deliver the Night's Watch’s urgent request for reinforcements to Stannis.
His crucial testimony in Season 6 secures Jon and Sansa support from Lady Mormont.

name: Brienne of Tarth
description:
In a world where warrior women are rare, Brienne of Tarth stands out as an extraordinary figure. Despite being ridiculed for her masculine appearance and unconventional femininity, she remains steadfast in her commitment to chivalry and honor. After failing to protect Renly Baratheon, who was one of the few to believe in her, she finds herself allied with Jaime Lannister—her polar opposite. Yet, against all odds, they form a unique bond that transcends their loyalties and Houses, creating one of the series' most memorable pairings.

On the battlefield, Brienne's formidable strength and mastery of Oathkeeper make her an unstoppable force, having defeated numerous foes and triumphed over the Hound in a brutal confrontation. As both unwaveringly loyal and impressively powerful, Brienne is an unforgettable character who garners admiration and support from viewers.
memorableMoments: Her quest to become a knight on Renly's Kingsguard earns her our enduring respect.
Jaime Lannister emerges as one of her most significant companions, highlighted by their iconic bath scene.
She brings the tale of 'The Bear and the Maiden Fair' to life with her battle against a bear at Harrenhal.

name: Petyr Baelish "Littlefinger"
description:
Lord Petyr Baelish, known as Littlefinger, masterminded the conspiracy that set the events of Game of Thrones into motion. By orchestrating Jon Arryn's death—Ned Stark's close ally—he maneuvered his way into power in King’s Landing. The former Master of Coin, now Lord Protector of the Eyrie and the Vale of Arryn, is renowned for his cunning and strategic mind. His web of secrets and plots rivals that of Varys, making him a central figure in Westeros' political intrigues.

Littlefinger's actions are driven by an overarching scheme to ascend through the chaos, aiming for power at all costs. Despite his notorious reputation for betrayal, his unreturned love for Catelyn and later her daughter Sansa adds a layer of vulnerability to his otherwise deceitful persona.
memorableMoments: Littlefinger betrays Ned Stark in Season 1, setting off a chain of events leading to the elder Stark's demise with the ominous line: 'I did warn you not to trust me.'
Demonstrating his affection for Sansa, he rescues her and smuggles her out of King’s Landing.
His timely arrival with the Vale's forces at the Battle of the Bastards, orchestrated by Sansa, turns the tide in a crucial moment.

name: Joffrey Baratheon
description:
Joffrey Baratheon, portrayed by Jack Gleeson, is often remembered as one of Game of Thrones' most despised characters. His tenure on the Iron Throne saw him transform from a spoiled young prince into a sadistic and self-righteous tyrant. This gradual descent was marked by cruelty and tyranny, making his reign feel like an inevitable yet horrifying train wreck.

Joffrey's role in destabilizing Westeros is significant; he was directly responsible for key events such as the execution of Ned Stark—deciding that the 'traitor' should be executed instead of given a chance at redemption. His erratic behavior and indifference to his people’s welfare forced others around him, including Tywin, Tyrion, Cersei, and Sansa, to adapt and rise to new challenges to either mitigate the chaos he caused or simply survive under his rule.

Despite being widely disliked, Joffrey's impact on the series is undeniable. His actions set off a chain of events that reshaped the political landscape of Westeros, making him a catalyst for change throughout the story.
memorableMoments: The audience’s disdain begins when he falsely accuses Arya and her direwolf Nymeria of attacking him, leading to the death of Mycah and his own direwolf Lady.
His order for Ned Stark's execution cements his place as one of the most hated characters in the series.
A memorable scene is Joffrey's murder on his wedding day, marked by the vivid image of his face turning purple.

name: Bran Stark
description:
From early in Game of Thrones' narrative, Bran Stark emerges as one of its most pivotal characters. His journey sets off critical events that drive much of the series' drama, and his unique abilities provide insight into the mystical aspects of this world.

Bran's quest to understand his powers leads him on a path toward the Three-Eyed Raven. This journey is marked by significant moments where he uncovers secrets from both the past and present, hinting at his future importance in the unfolding story.
memorableMoments: Demonstrating an early lesson of always listening to his mother, Bran unintentionally witnesses the Lannister twins in a compromising position, resulting in him being pushed out a window.
His latent magical abilities begin to surface as he connects with and eventually meets the Three-Eyed Raven.
In one of the series' pivotal moments, using his newfound powers, Bran inadvertently makes contact with the Night King.

name: Sandor Clegane "The Hound"
description: Despite his fearsome reputation as a dangerous fighter, Sandor 'The Hound' Clegane's journey from the shadows of his infamous brother Gregor to finding redemption captivates audiences. Initially serving as Joffrey Baratheon's guard, Sandor develops an unexpected empathy for those perceived as weak or underdog—qualities that manifest through his interactions with Sansa and Arya Stark. His transformation is a compelling narrative arc, skillfully portrayed by Rory McCann, who brings depth to the character's struggle between darkness and redemption.
memorableMoments: The audience glimpses Sandor’s softer side when he offers brusque comfort to Sansa after Joffrey assaults her in Season 1’s finale.
His simple but memorable request for 'two chickens' showcases his no-nonsense personality.
His unexpected return in Season 6 is both surprising and heartwarming, marking one of the show's most impactful moments.

name: Melisandre
description: As a shadowbinder and priestess to Stannis Baratheon, Melisandre's powerful magic and unwavering faith in identifying the prophesied messiah significantly impact Westeros. Her actions—ranging from summoning a shadow demon to assassinate Renly Baratheon to attempting to resurrect Jon Snow—are driven by her belief in fulfilling ancient prophecies. Her journey is marked by profound realizations as she confronts the limitations and misinterpretations of her beliefs.
memorableMoments: Melisandre's creation of a shadow demon to kill Renly Baratheon stands out as one of her most dramatic acts.
In a revealing moment, she sheds her magical disguise, unveiling herself as an ancient and weary woman.
Her pivotal role in resurrecting Jon Snow in Season 6 is hailed as one of the series' most memorable moments.

name: Theon Greyjoy
description: Raised as a ward under Ned Stark after his father's unsuccessful uprising, Theon Greyjoy always felt like an outsider in the Stark household. Despite being considered part of the family, he struggled with complex emotions toward the Starks. His deep-seated resentment and longing to claim his rightful place as the heir of the Iron Islands ultimately led him down a path of betrayal against those who raised him. Captured and brutally tortured by Ramsay Bolton following a failed rebellion, Theon was reduced to a broken individual known only as 'Reek.' Despite later being presented with an opportunity for redemption through aiding Sansa Stark's escape from Ramsay, he faltered. Now back with his sister Yara Greyjoy, it remains uncertain whether Theon can reclaim any sense of his former self and if he truly finds redemption in their quest to claim the Iron Throne.
memorableMoments: Theon incurs the audience’s wrath when he betrays the Starks by seizing control over Winterfell.
He garners sympathy as he endures capture and relentless torment at Ramsay Bolton's hands for several seasons.
His journey toward redemption begins as he assists Sansa Stark in escaping from Ramsay’s cruelty.

name: Margaery Tyrell
description: Margaery Tyrell is one of Game of Thrones' most captivating characters, known for her charm and strategic acumen. Her complexity lies in her ability to defy simple categorization; she oscillates between genuine kindness and calculated manipulation. Ambitious by nature and guided by the cunning wisdom of her grandmother Olenna, Margaery skillfully navigated the treacherous political landscape of King’s Landing. While some may question whether her concern for the less fortunate was sincere or merely a tactic to gain favor, her interactions with Tommen suggest a deeper layer of compassion, though always aligned with her overarching goals. Ultimately, Margaery's ability to devise and implement various strategies kept audiences engaged as she maneuvered through the challenges before her.
memorableMoments: Margaery demonstrates her political acumen by asserting herself not merely as a 'queen,' but as 'the queen.'
Her rivalry with Cersei takes a dramatic turn when she finds herself atoning for her actions under the High Sparrow's influence.
She remains endearing to fans for her thoughtful gesture of gifting Tommen Ser Pounce.

name: Bronn
description: Bronn stands out among Game of Thrones characters as an embodiment of integrity and straightforwardness, contrasting sharply with the often duplicitous nobility. As one of the few commoners to play a significant role in Westeros’ political intrigues, his unvarnished honesty offers a refreshing change from the usual scheming. Bronn’s journey begins as a sellsword who earns Tyrion Lannister's trust by defending him at the Eyrie, forming an enduring friendship. Later, he becomes Jaime Lannister's trusted companion and training partner, assisting the knight in adapting to life without his sword hand.
memorableMoments: Bronn solidifies his bond with Tyrion by fighting for him at the Eyrie.
He becomes a vital ally to Jaime Lannister, helping the knight train in swordsmanship despite being handless.
Throughout the series, Bronn's presence is consistently delightful due to Flynn’s adept comedic timing.

name: Stannis Baratheon
description: A complex figure in Game of Thrones, Stannis Baratheon is both revered and reviled. As King Robert’s younger brother, he was arguably the rightful heir to the throne, embodying a sense of duty and diligence that could have made him an effective ruler. However, his reign was overshadowed by his allegiance to Melisandre, a Red Priestess whose influence led Stannis into morally questionable actions under the guise of fulfilling prophecies through Lord of Light blood magic. While he often seemed like the lesser evil amid the chaos of power struggles in Westeros, there were moments when his decisions veered into cruelty, such as the harrowing decision to sacrifice his daughter.
memorableMoments: Succumbing to Melisandre’s influence, Stannis consummates their relationship on the Painted Table, resulting in her impregnation with a shadow creature.
In a poignant moment, Stannis recounts to Shireen why he chose to keep her alive, ending with a reluctant embrace that underscores his internal conflict.
The dramatic beheading by Brienne leaves viewers questioning his fate, only for it to be revealed that he did not survive the encounter.

name: Jorah Mormont
description: Jorah Mormont is a multifaceted character in Game of Thrones, embodying the roles of exile, spy, servant, and soldier. Initially introduced as Varys’s spy masquerading as Daenerys Targaryen's mentor, Jorah quickly develops a deep admiration—and ultimately love—for Khaleesi. Despite his affection, Daenerys does not reciprocate his feelings, leading to her banishing him once he is caught in deceitful activities. Driven by the desire for redemption, Jorah goes to great lengths to prove himself worthy of Dany's trust. He becomes a complex figure—loyal and wise yet entangled in betrayal against the woman he loves. Adding to his tragic arc, Jorah contracts greyscale, an incurable disease that marks him for death.
memorableMoments: Despite beginning as Varys's spy, Jorah demonstrates true loyalty to Daenerys by thwarting an assassination attempt on her life.
His banishment in Season 4 marks a crucial turning point for Jorah’s character development and quest for redemption.
In Season 5, while traveling with Tyrion Lannister, Jorah contracts greyscale, signaling the onset of his tragic downfall.

name: Olenna Tyrell
description: Known as the 'Queen of Thorns,' Olenna Tyrell is renowned for her sharp wit and no-nonsense demeanor. As the de facto leader of House Tyrell, she expertly maneuvers behind the scenes to advance the family's interests, often outsmarting those around her with her strategic acumen and incisive commentary. Olenna’s influence extends far beyond quiet conversations in garden paths or dining rooms; her skillfully chosen words can be as impactful as any military confrontation. She stands out through her exchanges with formidable figures like Tywin Lannister, Cersei Lannister, and the High Sparrow, showcasing her ability to leverage her economic power to assert dominance.
memorableMoments: From their first encounter, Olenna immediately sets herself apart with candid and impactful remarks, becoming an integral part of Westeros's narrative.
Her verbal sparring match with Tywin Lannister stands out as a highlight, emphasizing her formidable presence and intelligence.
Despite the demise of many Tyrells, Olenna remains undeterred. Her alliance with Ellaria Sand and the Sand Snakes signals thrilling schemes for retribution.

name: Ramsay Bolton
description: Ramsay Bolton epitomizes malevolence, embodying cruelty and sadism. His intelligence is wielded for nefarious purposes, making him one of the most chilling antagonists in Game of Thrones. The show delves into his complexity by examining his tumultuous relationship with his father and hinting at a capacity for love through his interactions with Myranda. Despite these layers, Ramsay remains a stark portrayal of human depravity, shaped by his harsh environment into a figure of terror. Iwan Rheon's performance adds depth to Ramsay, transforming him from a one-dimensional villain into a deeply unsettling character rooted in reality.
memorableMoments: Ramsay's cruel taunting of Theon Greyjoy with a sausage is a stark display of his sadistic nature.
His elevation to legitimate heir on the hills near Winterfell marks a significant power shift.
In 'The Battle of the Bastards,' Ramsay nearly topples Jon Snow’s army, showcasing his formidable military prowess.

name: Roose Bolton
description: Roose Bolton stands out among House Stark's betrayers as both cunning and somewhat pragmatic. As the mastermind behind the infamous Red Wedding, Roose delivered a chilling line with his phrase, ‘The Lannisters send their regards,’ while killing Robb Stark. He claimed Winterfell and the title of Warden of the North for himself but ultimately fell prey to his own son, Ramsay’s, madness. Though a significant antagonist in the series, Roose is portrayed more as an opportunist than pure evil. His complex relationship with Ramsay—who he initially turned a blind eye towards despite the boy's evident cruelty—is central to his character arc.
memorableMoments: The unforgettable line ‘The Lannisters send their regards’ was delivered by Roose as he plunged a knife into Robb Stark’s heart during the Red Wedding.
In the books, Roose is known for leeching himself, earning him the moniker 'Leech Lord.'
Despite Ramsay being his bastard son, Roose legitimized him in an emotionally charged moment.

name: Robb Stark
description: The eldest son of Ned Stark, Robb was poised to avenge his father's betrayal and murder. However, in the treacherous world of Westeros, his quest for redemption ended abruptly with the massacre at the Red Wedding. Known for his honor, Robb’s downfall began when he executed Lord Karstark for war crimes, leading to dissent among his followers that culminated in mutiny. Despite his noble intentions and leadership as 'King in the North,' it was ultimately his own oath-breaking that led to his tragic demise.
memorableMoments: In a rare tender moment from the series premiere, Robb discovers direwolf pups with his siblings and names his Grey Wind.
He is proudly hailed as the ‘King in the North’ by the lords who once pledged loyalty to his father, alongside Theon Greyjoy’s proclamation.
During the Red Wedding, Robb is paralyzed by shock and grief at the sight of his murdered wife Talisa, unable to fight back or flee.

name: Oberyn Martell
description: Princely and passionate, Oberyn Martell arrives in King’s Landing with a burning resentment towards Tywin Lannister for the death of his sister Elia during the sacking of King’s Landing. His introduction marks the first formal glimpse into Dorne's culture; he is both logical and fervent, restrained yet perilous. Though his time on screen was brief, Oberyn became iconic for his brave but ill-fated defense of Tyrion Lannister in a trial by combat against Ser Gregor Clegane.
memorableMoments: "I will be your champion." Oberyn agrees to fight Ser Gregor for an all-but condemned Tyrion.
The Red Viper kicked off his visit to King's Landing with quite the memorable orgy.
The Mountain vs. The Viper! So close, but then....POP!

name: Walder Frey
description: A detestable lord of the Riverlands, Walder Frey is despised for his craven nature and petty scheming. Despite this, he becomes pivotal in one of the series' most shocking events: the Red Wedding. Known for his numerous marriages and progeny, whose names even he barely remembers, Frey betrays Robb Stark by joining forces with the Lannisters after being slighted by a broken marriage promise.
memorableMoments: During the Red Wedding, Catelyn Stark threatens Walder’s wife, but her reassurance of finding another wife seals the Starks' fate.
The morning after the massacre, he raises a toast to Roose Bolton with the chilling words, "Here's to the young wolf!" followed by a haunting howl.
Arya Stark's grim retribution: discovering his sons baked into a meat pie.

name: Samwell Tarly
description: Despite being banished to the Wall by his overzealous father, Samwell Tarly finds solace and purpose among the Night's Watch. Known for his gentle spirit and love of books, he becomes an invaluable asset at Castle Black, taking on the role of scholar among warriors. As Jon Snow’s best friend, Sam endures numerous trials, from battles with White Walkers to diplomatic missions across Westeros, all while pursuing knowledge in places like Oldtown.
memorableMoments: In a daring confrontation, Sam disintegrates a formidable White Walker by stabbing it in the back with Dragonglass.
He advocates for Jon Snow’s leadership, nominating him as Lord Commander despite his youth: 'He may be young, but he's the commander we turned to when the night was darkest.'
Breaking his vows of celibacy, Sam and Gilly finally consummate their relationship, marking a significant personal milestone.

name: Ygritte
description: A fierce and resourceful Wildling warrior, Ygritte captivates Jon Snow with her intelligence and boldness during his time undercover within Mance Rayder's Free Folk army. Their complex relationship creates tension when Jon’s true allegiance as a member of the Night’s Watch is revealed. Ygritte remains unforgettable for her fiery spirit, deep connection with Jon, and poignant final moments at Castle Black.
memorableMoments: Ygritte and Jon share intimate moments in the secluded hot springs cave, highlighting their unexpected bond.
Despite her love for him, Ygritte reluctantly shoots three arrows at an unwilling Jon as he tries to return to his Night’s Watch duties.
In her last breaths during a fierce battle, she whispers to Jon, 'You know nothing, Jon Snow…', echoing one of the series' most iconic lines and underscoring their complicated relationship.

name: The Night King
description: Created by the Children of the Forest as a formidable protector against the First Men, The Night King emerges as the chilling leader of the White Walkers and their undead army. His mysterious powers, including his ability to create White Walkers with a touch, present an unprecedented threat that eclipses all other conflicts in Westeros. The Night King's presence ushers in a long-anticipated winter, embodying the ultimate evil against which humanity must unite.
memorableMoments: In a chilling act of power, The Night King touches Craster’s infant son, initiating his transformation into a White Walker.
He confronts Jon Snow with an intense staredown at Hardhome, a pivotal moment underscoring his relentless pursuit.
During an encounter within Bran’s vision, The Night King marks the psychic Stark by grasping his arm, hinting at deeper plans and connections.

name: Ser Gregor Clegane
description: Known as 'The Mountain' due to his immense size and strength, Ser Gregor Clegane is notorious across Westeros for his brutality and unwavering loyalty to House Lannister. His menacing presence is often a harbinger of violence and despair, whether through his merciless acts at Harrenhal or his role in executing Cersei’s ruthless commands. Perhaps most infamous for the gruesome beheading of Oberyn Martell, Gregor epitomizes a relentless force of destruction.
memorableMoments: Following his notorious display of petulance by decapitating his own horse, Gregor engages in a fierce duel with his brother Sandor, which is abruptly ended by King Robert.
In a brutal showdown at the Red Wedding, he mercilessly defeats Oberyn Martell by crushing the 'Viper’s' face, demonstrating his fearsome combat prowess.

name: Robert Baratheon
description: A central figure in the early episodes of 'Game of Thrones,' King Robert plays a pivotal role in Westeros’s history. As an old friend of Eddard Stark, he spearheaded the rebellion against the tyrannical Mad King Aerys II, ultimately leading to Robert's ascent to the throne after marrying Lyanna Stark. However, his rule is marked by neglect and indulgence, which contributes significantly to the political turmoil that defines the series.
memorableMoments: In a poignant moment at Winterfell’s Stark crypt, Robert mourns beside the statue of his beloved wife, Lyanna, away from the prying eyes of Queen Cersei.
During a rare private exchange with Cersei, he confesses how no amount of power could fill the void left by Lyanna’s death, showcasing his vulnerability and regret.
On his deathbed, Robert entrusts Eddard Stark as 'Lord Regent' and attempts to revoke the assassination orders on Daenerys, highlighting his late efforts to amend past mistakes.

name: Gilly
description: Introduced as one of Craster's daughter-wives in the harsh world north of the Wall, Gilly’s life changes dramatically upon meeting Samwell Tarly. Initially pregnant with Craster’s son, she gives birth to her child amidst turmoil and flees with Sam during a Night’s Watch mutiny after witnessing him slay a White Walker with Dragonglass.
memorableMoments: Recognizing Samwell's ability to glean knowledge from written words, she exclaims he is akin to a wizard.
Amidst danger posed by the Night’s Watch, Gilly provides care for the wounded Sam and becomes his first intimate partner after he intervenes on her behalf.
Defying her fears, Gilly bravely stands up for Sam in front of his disapproving family, revealing his heroic deeds against formidable foes like a Thenn and a White Walker.

name: Tormund Giantsbane
description: A formidable Wildling warrior, Tormund is known for his immense size and large ego. His journey with Jon Snow evolves from bonding over Ygritte to becoming the leader of the Free Folk after Mance Rayder’s execution. He forms a truce with Jon to unite against the White Walkers, surviving key battles like the Battle for the Wall and Hardhome. Now, he shows interest in Lady Brienne.
memorableMoments: An iconic scene features Tormund scaling the Wall with determination using a pickaxe.
At Hardhome, after being labeled a traitor, Tormund decisively defeats the 'Lord of Bones.'
In Season 6, his burgeoning attraction to Brienne adds an intriguing dynamic to their interactions.

name: Grey Worm
description: Once an enslaved warrior-eunuch, Grey Worm becomes one of Daenerys Targaryen’s most trusted advisors and leader of the Unsullied. Known for his stoic demeanor, he surprises fans by developing a deep connection with Missandei. His unwavering loyalty and combat prowess make him indispensable in Dany's forces.
memorableMoments: Despite Daenerys ordering the Unsullied to abandon their slave names, Grey Worm chooses to keep his as a testament to his past and the freedom she granted.
During recovery from injuries in an ambush, he confesses to Missandei that he feared they might never see each other again.

name: Yara Greyjoy
description: After her brothers' tragic deaths during Balon Greyjoy's failed rebellion, Yara steps into a leadership role. Known for her naval prowess and sharp wit, she initially harbors resentment towards Theon but eventually reveals loyalty toward him. Joining forces with Daenerys Targaryen, she seeks to become the rightful ruler of the Iron Isles.
memorableMoments: During their first encounter post-separation, Theon fails to recognize Yara and attempts an awkward advance. Yara allows this moment to play out, using it to humiliate him.
In a daring rescue attempt for Theon at the Dreadfort, she discovers him broken and cowering in his cage, prompting her poignant remark, 'My brother's dead,' before retreating.
At their initial meeting with Daenerys in Meereen, subtle exchanges between Yara and Dany spark intrigue and speculation about potential alliances.

name: Podrick Payne
description: Starting as a humble squire to Tyrion Lannister, Podrick proves his worth through loyalty and bravery. Known for his dry humor and steady presence, he navigates Westeros with an unexpected skillset that endears him to both allies and foes. From crucial rescues in battle to navigating complex social situations, Podrick evolves into a key figure who provides comic relief amidst the show's darker themes.
memorableMoments: During the Battle of the Blackwater, Podrick heroically thwarts Ser Mandon Moore’s assassination attempt on Tyrion with a well-placed spear.

In an amusing encounter at a local brothel, Podrick shares that his 'abilities' were so appreciated that the women declined to charge him, leading to a memorable exchange between him, Tyrion, and Bronn.

name: Meera Reed
description: Introduced as a steadfast companion to her younger brother Jojen and Bran Stark, Meera's primary role is to protect Jojen and guide them northward. Lacking supernatural abilities herself, she relies on strength, resourcefulness, and survival skills to navigate the perils beyond the Wall. Her unwavering loyalty and fierce determination make her an invaluable ally in their quest to meet the Three-Eyed Raven.
memorableMoments: Demonstrating her formidable skills, Meera nearly engages in a playful altercation with Osha over who can skin a rabbit more efficiently.
Outside of the show, Meera has become central to a popular fan theory concerning the Tower of Joy, sparking curiosity and speculation among fans.
